fields.title: Customer satisfaction through early and continuous software delivery
fields.content: Customers are happier when they receive working software at regular intervals, rather than waiting extended periods of time between releases.

fields.title: Accommodate changing requirements throughout the development process
fields.content: The ability to avoid delays when a requirement or feature request changes.

fields.title: Frequent delivery of working software
fields.content: Scrum accommodates this principle since the team operates in software sprints or iterations that ensure regular delivery of working software.

fields.title: Collaboration between the business stakeholders and developers throughout the project
fields.content: Better decisions are made when the business and technical team are aligned.

fields.title: Support, trust, and motivate the people involved
fields.content: Motivated teams are more likely to deliver their best work than unhappy teams.

fields.title: Enable face-to-face interactions
fields.content: Communication is more successful when development teams are co-located.

fields.title: Working software is the primary measure of progress
fields.content: Delivering functional software to the customer is the ultimate factor that measures progress.

fields.title: Agile processes to support a consistent development pace
fields.content: Teams establish a repeatable and maintainable speed at which they can deliver working software, and they repeat it with each release.

fields.title: Attention to technical detail and design enhances agility
fields.content: The right skills and good design ensures the team can maintain the pace, constantly improve the product, and sustain change.

fields.title: Simplicity
fields.content: Develop just enough to get the job done for right now.

fields.title: Self-organizing teams encourage great architectures, requirements, and designs
fields.content: Skilled and motivated team members who have decision-making power, take ownership, communicate regularly with other team members, and share ideas that deliver quality products.

fields.title: Regular reflections on how to become more effective
fields.content: Self-improvement, process improvement, advancing skills, and techniques help team members work more efficiently.
